00020 
00021 class wxDC;
00022 class wxRect;
00023 
00024 class DirManager;
00025 class Alg_seq;   // from "allegro.h"
00026 
00027 class NoteTrack:public Track {
00028  public:
00029    friend class TrackArtist;
00030 
00031    NoteTrack(DirManager * projDirManager);
00032 
00033    virtual Track *Duplicate();
00034    
00035    virtual int GetKind() const { return Note; } 
00036 
00037    virtual double GetStartTime() { return 0.0; }
00038    virtual double GetEndTime() { return mLen; }
00039 
00040    void DrawLabelControls(wxDC & dc, wxRect & r);
00041    bool LabelClick(wxRect & r, int x, int y, bool right);
00042 
00043    void SetSequence(Alg_seq *seq);
00044    Alg_seq* GetSequence();
00045    void PrintSequence();
00046 
00047    int GetVisibleChannels();
00048 
00049    bool ExportMIDI(wxString f);
00050    bool ExportAllegro(wxString f);
00051 
00052 /* REQUIRES PORTMIDI */
00053 //   int GetLastMidiPosition() const { return mLastMidiPosition; }
00054 //   void SetLastMidiPosition( int position )
00055 //   {
00056 //      mLastMidiPosition = position;
00057 //   }
00058 
00059    // High-level editing
00060    virtual bool Cut  (double t0, double t1, Track **dest);
00061    virtual bool Copy (double t0, double t1, Track **dest);
00062    virtual bool Clear(double t0, double t1);
00063    virtual bool Paste(double t, Track *src);
00064 
00065    int GetBottomNote() const { return mBottomNote; }
00066    void SetBottomNote(int note) 
00067    { 
00068       if (note < 0)
00069          note = 0;
00070       else if (note > 96)
00071          note = 96;
00072 
00073       mBottomNote = note; 
00074    }
00075 
00076    virtual bool HandleXMLTag(const wxChar *tag, const wxChar **attrs);
00077    virtual XMLTagHandler *HandleXMLChild(const wxChar *tag);
00078    virtual void WriteXML(XMLWriter &xmlFile);
00079 
00080  private:
00081    Alg_seq *mSeq; // NULL means no sequence
00082    // when Duplicate() is called, assume that it is to put a copy
00083    // of the track into the undo stack or to redo/copy from the
00084    // stack to the project object. We want copies to the stack
00085    // to be serialized (therefore compact) representations, so
00086    // copy will set mSeq to NULL and serialize to the following
00087    // variables. If this design is correct, the track will be
00088    // duplicated again (in the event of redo) back to the project
00089    // at which point we will unserialize the data back to the
00090    // mSeq variable. (TrackArtist should check to make sure this
00091    // flip-flop from mSeq to mSerializationBuffer happened an
00092    // even number of times, otherwise mSeq will be NULL).
00093    void *mSerializationBuffer; // NULL means no buffer
00094    long mSerializationLength;
00095    double mLen;
00096 
00097    DirManager *mDirManager;
00098 
00099    int mBottomNote;
00100 
00101    int mVisibleChannels;
00102    int mLastMidiPosition;
00103 };
00104 
00105 #endif // USE_MIDI

00107 #endif
